image.altText: Man drives boat on river with fishing rods above head

props.synopsis: Bill Yan is volunteering as chief marshal at the five-day Barramundi Classic on the Daly River, but has not taken leave from his ministerial role.

title.children: NT treasurer spends week at fishing comp, days out from first budget

image.altText: ADF and Port of Darwin workers rearm Australian, Canadian and US Warships at Port of Darwin 2024 Credit ADF

props.synopsis: Experts say the inclusion of new destinations for United States military cargo shipments, and their increasing lethality, marks a shift in US posturing in Australia and the Indo-Pacific region.

title.children: US expected to ship 'radioactive' materials to Australian ports in arms expansion

image.altText: Federal shadow minister for Indigenous Australians Jacinta Price standing and speaking outside a voting centre.

props.synopsis: Firebrand senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price's shock defection to the Liberal Party is condemned by one insider as a hostile takeover attempt and a form of "desperate branch stacking" to boost Angus Taylor's leadership hopes.

title.children: Price defection slammed as Taylor and Ley confirm plans to run

image.altText: An older man stands in front of rows of wine in a store.

props.synopsis: A mourner of grocer Linford Feick, who was fatally stabbed last month, was taken to hospital with an eye injury after being struck by a brick thrown from a moving car.

title.children: Slain NT grocer funeral guest hit by brick allegedly thrown at car

image.altText: Two men on a boat, both wearing light blue hoodies and holding fishing rods.

props.synopsis: About 150 competitive anglers travel to Daly River for the annual Barramundi Classic.

title.children: Iconic fishing competition draws anglers to the NT's remote Daly River

image.altText: A coast beachside, palm trees, bitumen walking and cycling path. Shirtless cyclist in sight, along with people walking.

props.synopsis: NT police have charged a teenage boy in relation to six separate incidents that allegedly involved the indecent assault of women at a popular Darwin walking spot and local hospital car park.

title.children: Boy charged over series of indecent assaults at popular walking spot

image.altText: A man walks towards left of camera on an AFL oval with Port Power and Sydney Swans players behind him

props.synopsis: The AFL has handed a one-match ban to Port Adelaide's Willie Rioli despite the forward already withdrawing from this week’s Showdown against the Crows.

title.children: Port Adelaide's Willie Rioli withdraws from Showdown as AFL hands down sanction

image.altText: A very tight close up of an Aboriginal woman's face, blonde hair holding a serious but relaxed expression. Background blurred

props.synopsis: Overcrowding, poor access to healthcare, and antisocial behaviour in remote NT communities is pushing people into city centres. Once they arrive, it can be a cycle of temporary accommodation and homelessness.

title.children: Declining living standards in remote NT forces many into homelessness

image.altText: Pope Leo XIV waving on the central loggia of St. Peter's Basilica

props.synopsis: Chicago-born Robert Prevost, now Pope Leo XIV, has been elected as pontiff. Here's what's anticipated from his papacy when it comes to key issues facing the Church.

title.children: Where does Pope Leo XIV stand on key issues facing the Catholic Church?

image.altText: Pope Leo XIV waving on the central loggia of St. Peter's Basilica

props.synopsis: Robert Prevost — who was brought to the Vatican in 2023 as the powerful head of the office that vets bishop nominations — becomes the first pontiff born in the United States.

title.children: Who is Pope Leo XIV and why does he overcome a taboo against a US pontiff?

image.altText: Keir Starmer and Donald Trump shake hands and make eye contact

props.synopsis: Australian shares closed higher on Friday ahead of this weekend's US trade talks with China, while US shares extend recent gains as Donald Trump's administration strikes its first post "Liberation Day" deal. Look back on the day's financial news and insights from our specialist business reporters on our live blog.

title.children: ASX closes up ahead of US trade talks with China — as it happened

image.altText: Stuart MacGill wearing a suit outside court

props.synopsis: Former Australian cricketer Stuart MacGill avoids jail after being found guilty of taking part in the supply of cocaine in Sydney.

title.children: Retired cricketer sentenced over 'indispensable role' in $330k drug deal

image.altText: A gecko peeks out of the palm of someone's hands.

props.synopsis: New Caledonia's giant geckos are the latest sensation in the global pet trade. But conservationists warn their social media-fuelled popularity is putting the endangered species at risk.

title.children: The online gecko craze turning into a conservation nightmare

image.altText: Former Queensland Government minister Gordon Nuttall

props.synopsis: From politician to prisoner, Gordon Nuttall has died aged 71 years old after being diagnosed with stage four kidney cancer.

title.children: Disgraced former Queensland minister Gordon Nuttall dies

image.altText: Lalith Krishnamurthy standing in front of a lake

props.synopsis: The promise by Prime Minister Anthony Albanese to not leave anyone behind struck a chord with many in the Indian diaspora.

title.children: Why do so many Indians continue voting Labor? It's not just about immigration

image.altText: Painting of black and white figure suspended in air.

props.synopsis: Women's labour is in the spotlight in Brisbane artist Julie Fragar's portrait Flagship Mother Multiverse (Justene), which has won the $100,000 Archibald Prize.

title.children: Julie Fragar wins $100,000 Archibald Prize for portrait of fellow artist

image.altText: image of convicted terrorist Abdul Benbrika

props.synopsis: Notorious Australian terrorist leader Abdul Nacer Benbrika organised funding for radical preacher Wisam Haddad's hate-speech legal battle against Australia's peak Jewish body.

title.children: Meeting with hate preacher triggers court order for notorious terror leader

image.altText: Cassius montage

props.synopsis: A memorial plaque for Cassius Turvey in his community of Midland, east of Perth, sits as an enduring reminder of the legacy he left behind: "gentle giant", "huggable teddy bear", and a "young leader".

title.children: Big in stature, with even bigger heart, Cassius's death shocked nation

image.altText: Owen Cooper leans back in a chair and smirks while acting in Adolescence.

props.synopsis: The TV show has adults talking or, shall we say, anxious. But what do young people think about it?

title.children: 'It's like real life': Teens divided over showing Adolescence in schools

image.altText: Raghe Mohammed Abdi smiles a the camera. He wears a school uniform consisting of a maroon jacket and tie, and a blue shirt.

props.synopsis: Raghe Mohamed Adbi murdered two people before he was shot and killed by police on the Logan Motorway.

title.children: Coroner unable to determine 'radicalised' man's motive for killing elderly couple

image.altText: Man wearing baseball cap and khaki green t-shirt standing next to household Tesla battery

props.synopsis: In the rush to install ever more solar and, now, batteries on people's homes, one consumer warns of the risks of giving control to big energy.

title.children: An energy giant 'drained' this householder's battery

image.altText: A man holds a dog by the collar.

props.synopsis: A man jailed for his role in a dog fighting ring remains a member of multiple online groups that discuss the blood sport, even boasting that he has killed "more dogs than parvovirus".

title.children: Man linked to dog fighting ring boasted he 'killed more dogs than parvovirus'

image.altText: Pakistani investigators collect pieces of a suspected Indian drone.

props.synopsis: Blasts have rung out across the Indian city of Jammu during what the government said was a Pakistani drone and missile attack on military stations around the Kashmir region on the second day of clashes between the nuclear-armed neighbours.

title.children: India says military stations were attacked by Pakistani drones and missiles

image.altText: Romney Hamilton and her husband and dog

props.synopsis: The celebration of Mother's Day can be triggering for people who have experienced infertility or are trying for a baby.

title.children: Getting through Mother's Day if you're struggling with infertility

image.altText: A close up photo of a phone with dating apps like Tinder, Grindr and Bumble on the screen.

props.synopsis: Police say groups of criminals have allegedly used fake profiles on dating platforms like Grindr to lure victims into being attacked and robbed.

title.children: Criminals used fake Grindr profiles to lure victims, Victoria Police say

image.altText: High school students feed a sheep.

props.synopsis: Four years ago almost half of the students left this Brisbane high school without plans for work or study — financial literacy has turned that around.

title.children: 'Choice not chance': How financial literacy changed a high school

image.altText: The side of a large ship in port.

props.synopsis: Another $120 million cost blowout hits the embattled Spirit of Tasmania vessel replacement project, with berth infrastructure set to cost $493 million.

title.children: Spirit berth gets $120m blowout but earlier completion date, government says

image.altText: GettyImages-2206309175

props.synopsis: Essendon ruck Sam Draper details the emotional toll of his season-ending Achilles rupture, which he says felt very unfair given his career-best form.

title.children: 'I've cried that much': Essendon star details toll of brutal injury

image.altText: Michael Storer competes at Paris Nice in the snow

props.synopsis: There are 14 Australian riders riding this year's Giro d'Italia, but Michael Storer is coming in with red-hot form and a dream of usurping the long list of favourites, who will have their own Aussie riders in support.

title.children: How this understated Aussie's 'unreal' level could upset the Giro favourites

image.altText: A man crouches in shallow water with a fish in his hands which he is lowering into the water

props.synopsis: They may be river fish, but a truckload of Murray cod will make their new home in a volcanic crater to fight pests and attract tourists.

title.children: The powerful fish that could boost tourism and kill a reviled pest

image.altText: A dead penguin lays on a beach.

props.synopsis: The Department for Environment and Water said it was unclear at this stage if new penguin deaths on the Eyre Peninsula were linked to the ongoing algal bloom across South Australia.

title.children: Dead little penguins wash up on multiple Eyre Peninsula beaches

image.altText: Suited choir gesture with arms while standing on steps

props.synopsis: With an election, a papal conclave, and a whole lot of wild outfits on the Met Gala red carpet, it's been a big week in news. See how much you remember from the week that was.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Dutton's seat, the Met Gala and Trump

image.altText: Maro Itoje sits with Andy Farrell

props.synopsis: The British and Irish Lions name the squad ahead of this year's tour of Australia. Here's everything you need to know about who has been selected.

title.children: A ringer, a Rebel and two Aussies are named for the British and Irish Lions

image.altText: Wynyard Wildcatz 3

props.synopsis: Many of the team of cheerleading girls from a tiny town in Tasmania had never even been on a plane, let alone left their country, but a fundraising effort to see them sent to the US has paid off.

title.children: Tears, joy at Tassie girls' shock win at US cheerleading competition
